messages.title: Keeping the police on our streets
messages.content: Jonathan Fryer and the local Liberal Democrats are appalled by Boris Johnson's plan to cut police numbers in London. 'I have contacted London Assembly members to fight these cuts. The people of Tower Hamlets are sick living in fear of crime, and I will make to sure that streets are properly policed.'

messages.title: Renewing the East End spirit
messages.content: We must put a true community spirit back into the life of London's East End. Many local people have told Jonathan Fryer how disappointed they have been with their local Labour MP's actions and comments that have caused splits in our community rather than helping us all pull together.

messages.title: Educating our Children
messages.content: Every child is different, so schools need to be free to teach children in different ways to get the very best to get an excellent education because it is the best way to get on in life, get a good job and learn about the world. We will cut class sizes, allow teachers to spend more time in the classroom and raise standards for everyone else. We will put in more money for things like one-to-one tuition and evening classes. In Tower Hamlets, these Lib Dem policies will help thousands of local children.

messages.title: My contract with the people of Poplar and Limehouse
messages.content: I will put local people first. I will be there to help, listen to your concerns, and stand up for our community. I will make sure your voice is heard locally and at Westminster. I will be a strong voice for Poplar and Limehouse. I will be open and honest about expenses and ensure that I am representing you.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight against the cut of police numbers in London, ensuring that streets are properly policed.
Work to restore true community spirit in the East End and address the divisions caused by the local Labour MP's actions.
Push for varied teaching methods that cater to different children, smaller class sizes, increased one-to-one tuition, and evening classes to improve educational standards.
Listen and respond to the concerns of the people in Poplar and Limehouse and represent them with transparency, especially concerning MP expenses.

issues.education: Lib Dem policies will help thousands of local children.

images.caption: Jonathan Fryer pictured with local people and law enforcement, discussing community and education.
Jonathan Fryer alongside another member of the Liberal Democrats, highlighting support within his party.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes Jonathan Fryer's commitment to community, education, and responsive representation. Specific policies and constituency needs are addressed rather than a broader political manifesto.
